results.content:
Sure that the course is full of information, but comparing to the other best quality course that are existing on Udemy, the lecturer could have done the effort to implement an example, or examples instead of giving a course video/slides

It's still a good course, but the lecturer could have done more

results.content: Very good course, well explained, with a good insight to the basic concepts, patterns and wordings of OAuth2. I especially liked the comparison to SAML and how to put OAuth2 into a more general application security frame. Good explanation of what OIDC adds to OAuth2. And finally a very helpful short list of do's and don'ts when using or implementing it.
results.content_html: Very good course, well explained, with a good insight to the basic concepts, patterns and wordings of OAuth2. I especially liked the comparison to SAML and how to put OAuth2 into a more general application security frame. Good explanation of what OIDC adds to OAuth2. And finally a very helpful short list of do's and don'ts when using or implementing it.

results.content: The course improved my understanding of OAUTH and also taught me OIDC

results.content: So far, it is a little bit below my level of knowledge, but this is to be expected for an introduction. Information is concise and clear, though the  videos themselves could be improved by having more movement and fewer instances of slides remaining in place while the lecturer is speaking.

response.content: Thanks for making some progress in the course and for the feedback. Looking forward to your thoughts on the security details in the later sections.
